seisflows3.system.workstation

This is a subclass seisflows.system.workstation Provides utilities for submitting jobs in serial on a single machine

Module Contents

Classes

Workstation

Run tasks in a serial fashion on a single local machine

Attributes

PAR

PATH

seisflows3.system.workstation.PAR
seisflows3.system.workstation.PATH
class seisflows3.system.workstation.Workstation(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: custom_import('system', 'base')

Run tasks in a serial fashion on a single local machine

logger
property required(self)

A hard definition of paths and parameters required by this class, alongside their necessity for the class and their string explanations.

check(self, validate=True)

Checks parameters and paths

submit(self)

Submits the main workflow job

run(self, classname, method, single=False, **kwargs)

Executes task multiple times in serial.

Note

kwargs will be passed to the underlying method that is called

Parameters

  • classname (str) – the class to run

  • method (str) – the method from the given classname to run

  • single (bool) – run a single-process, non-parallel task, such as smoothing the gradient, which only needs to be run by once. This will change how the job array and the number of tasks is defined, such that the job is submitted as a single-core job to the system.

taskid(self)

Provides a unique identifier for each running task, which should be set by the ‘run’’ command.

Return type

int

Returns

returns the os environment variable SEISFLOWS_TASKID which is set by run() to label each of the currently running processes on the SYSTEM.
